title: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Continuing from 288125 after botched retarget.

A recent update to xdg-utils (#285233) added xdg-user-dirs as a dep. Since then we've had a few reports of people running macOS with xdg-utils in their system for one reason or another getting a failure on xdg-user-dirs.

I'm not sure it makes high-level sense to use it on macOS, but it was easy to get it to build...

Description of changes

items.title: xdg-user-dirs: fix darwin builds

items.content_html:
Description of changes

#285233 causes build failures on Darwin, as noted in the pull request. Since upstream provides partial support for Darwin, I recommend continuing this support. Alternatively, consider removing Darwin from the supported platforms list.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Recently xdg-utils were become broken on darwin and that broke aws-vault darwin build for no reason.
aws-vault uses open on darwin https://github.com/skratchdot/open-golang/blob/master/open/open.go

items.title: Add xdg-desktop-portal-termfilechooser and associated  module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Potential fix for #160923 although is not currently enabled by default.

MERGED Until #181171 gets merged, this relies on enabling an overlay for all those packages to actually use the xdg-open implementation from the path.

Many other packages rely on it implicitly without adding it in a wrapper so will work already without the overlay.

Some other things like the steam FHS env also require the overlay currently. Could get them to pick it up from the PATH in a subsequent PR?

items.title: nixos/xdg/xdg-open: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

x-d-p only looks for portal definitions in one of two places:

  • datadir (which we cannot install anything to, since Nix packages are immutable)
  • when XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR environment variable is set, the path specified therein
    (meant for tests, disables looking for portal configuration anywhere else)

Let‚Äôs introduce our own NIX_XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR environment variable
that will only control the portal definitions lookup.
We will not use it for searching for configuration
because it would require looking in the parent directory
and XDG_CONFIG_DIRS variable is sufficient for us.

Things done

items.title: xdg-desktop-portal: fix build when doCheck = false

items.content_html:
I don't think it's necessary to bundle/"hard-code" xdg-utils into the chromium source code, as all the binaries in there aren't hardcoded (I checked the relevant chromium source). Since xdg-utils is later added/wrapped to the PATH anyway here:

nixpkgs/pkgs/applications/networking/browsers/chromium/default.nix

Line 215 in da2f86c

export PATH="\$PATH\''${PATH:+:}${xdg-utils}/bin"

I think we should probably minimize build dependencies as much as possible if it can be wrapped later to avoid cache invalidation.
I'm currently rebuilding the world (and especially chromium takes up a good chunk of the time) because of something like this:
https://github.com/Philipp-M/nixos-config/blob/28d77ea08aaccf4544de3d2903210cd6037e3ca2/configuration.nix#L23

Description of changes

items.title: quakespasm: improve xdg desktop file, copy icons

items.content_html:
Ref: NixOS/nix#5588

This searches in $XDG_DATA_HOME/nix/profile everywhere where
previously we only looked in ~/.nix-profile, ditto for
.nix-channels and .nix-defexpr. This shouldn't break any
compatibility for now. It is highly recommended to use nixpkgs with
these changes if you want to use Nix with the XDG basedir PR, but not
doing so shouldn't result in any dramatic breakage -- in fact, NixOS
is perfectly usable without any user profile.
